definition: to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: EXITO's National China Clays Mining Industry Report-Industry Response|Purpose of Survey|Methodology|Survey Response Rate Demographic Data – New Zealand China Clays Mining Industry…
sentences.chinese: 澳洲論文網提供新西蘭與中國粘土採礦業研究報告。

sentences.english: Chinese-owned enterprises have pumped money into Zambia's mining sector in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，中資企業一直在向贊比亞的採礦業注資。

sentences.english: Although China currently monopolizes rare earth mining, other countries have deposits too.
sentences.chinese: 儘管中國現在壟斷了稀土採礦業，其它國家也有儲量。

sentences.english: Also providing advanced equipment and consumables for the mining industry.
sentences.chinese: 還提供先進的裝備和消耗品的採礦業。

sentences.english: Accordingly, using trackless equipment is an important approach to improve mining activities.
sentences.chinese: 因此利用無軌設備進行開採是採礦業發展的重要途徑。

sentences.english: It raises questions for the whole mining industry in terms of supplying China.
sentences.chinese: 這讓人們對向中國供應產品的整個採礦業發生了懷疑。

sentences.english: Although China currently monopolizes rare earth mining, other countries have deposits too. China has 48 percent of the world's reserves; the United States has 13 percent.
sentences.chinese: 儘管中國現在壟斷了稀土採礦業，其它國家也有儲量。

sentences.english: Mining industry was one of the important pillar industries in Song County, He nan Province.
sentences.chinese: 採礦業是河南省嵩縣的重要支柱產業之一。

sentences.english: THE past half-dozen years have been kind to miners.
sentences.chinese: 過去的六年，採礦業有福了。

pinyin: Guo2 jia1 Dian4 wang3 Gong1 si1
